file_content.text: The first member of the new Bane Brigade. It is my pleasure.
We should speak, but not here--these meetings will draw suspicion. Return to the landing pad and I will contact you.
Whatever you do, whomever you kill, it will add to the legend of the Bane Brigade.
...if the Bane Brigade is alive, we need reinforcements on Hoth immediately.
If they're alive, yes--but I saw them die years ago. No one survived that explosion.
The Bane Brigade destroyed my people's capital. We must know the truth.
We intercepted that holocall an hour ago. The Republic will soon send its elite troops into Clabburn Tundra, seeking the Bane Brigade.
There, our foot soldiers will set ambushes, collapse mountains... Clabburn is a natural death trap, and we need only sacrifice a few pawns to destroy the enemy's champions.
I see why you wanted to speak privately. The Bane Brigade is an illusion--the bait in your trap.
So there is no Bane Brigade.
It was real once, but no more.
You talk about sacrificing Imperial troops... how many?
How many Imperial casualties?
A few thousand, perhaps. A few might dig out of the ice--that's not the delicate part.
What makes you so sure the Republic will send anyone? Those generals didn't sound convinced.
Maybe the enemy won't come.
A... delicate question.
You see, the Republic was right to think the Bane Brigade destroyed; those men and women died heroes. Thus the secrecy, and your presence.
You must strike so fiercely, hurt the Republic so deeply, that they believe the Bane Brigade still lives. Only then will they commit their most elite forces.
You spread the rumors, I convince the Republic they're true--and they come chasing ghosts.
We become the brigade. Clever.
What defeated the brigade?
They attacked a Jedi encampment--slaughtered the lot, but they lingered too long and the Republic responded with an aerial strike. They deserved... better.
You told me the Bane Brigade was here. You told the troops.
You've been lying to everyone.
The rumors must begin somewhere. Information leaks, after all.
You will do tremendous deeds in the Bane Brigade's name, and only you and I shall know the truth.
And once you have finished, you shall leave Hoth and continue your work elsewhere--but the myth of the Bane Brigade will live on.
I will be the final chapter of the Bane Brigade's legend.
You will have your myth.
Legends and heroes are easy enough to manipulate. True power is rarely so blatant.
Myths are my toys.
I couldn't agree more, my lord.
Intelligence specializes in this sort of operation. I'll give the Republic whatever proof they require.
Leave it to me.
I kill people so you can build someone else's myth? It's a deal.
I've taken stranger jobs.
What do I get in return?
If you have no sense of duty, then I will open my vaults to you--I've developed quite a collection over the decades.
Don't worry--I'm quite used to working with mercenaries, and I think you'll be pleased.
If the Republic must fear someone, let them fear me.
I'd rather act in my own name.
In days to come, they may. But your name is not yet legend.
I can direct you to where your presence will be most impactful--soldiers who will show you the Republic's vulnerabilities.
When the snow is hot with blood, leave the rest to me and the ghost of the Bane Brigade.
Please excuse me. I have a war to win.
